header: The Lord Calls His People Back

verse: In the eighth month [October/November on our calendar; the Hebrew month of Cheshvan] of the second year Darius was king [520 bc; Darius was king of Persia 522–486 bc], the ·Lord spoke his word [word of the Lord came] to the prophet Zechariah son of Berekiah, who was the son of Iddo [a priestly family; Neh. 12:4, 16]. The Lord said,
“The Lord was very angry with your ·ancestors [fathers].

So tell the people: This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘Return to me, and I will return to you,’ says the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts].

Don’t be like your ·ancestors [fathers]. ·In the past the [The former/earlier] prophets said to them: This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘·Stop [Turn from] your evil ways and evil actions.’ But they wouldn’t listen or pay attention to me, says the Lord.
Your ·ancestors [fathers] ·are dead [where are they…?], and those prophets ·didn’t [do they…?] live forever.

I commanded my words and ·laws [statutes] to my servants the prophets, and ·they preached to [or they came true to; did they not overtake…?] your ·ancestors [fathers], who returned to me. They said, ‘The Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] did as he ·said he would [determined to do]. He punished us for ·the way we lived and for what we did [our ways and deeds].’”

It was on the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month [February 15, 519 bc], which is the month of Shebat, in Darius’s second year as king [v. 1]. The ·Lord spoke his word [word of the Lord came] to the prophet Zechariah son of Berekiah, who was the son of Iddo.
During the night I had a vision. I saw a man ·riding [or sitting on] a red horse. He was standing among some myrtle trees in a ravine, with red, brown, and white horses behind him [Rev. 6].
I asked, “What are these, ·sir [or my lord]?”
Then the man standing among the myrtle trees explained, “They are the ones the Lord ·sent [sent to walk/patrol] through all the earth.”

Then they spoke to the ·Lord’s angel [or angel of the Lord; an OT figure closely identified with the Lord himself; Gen. 16:11; 22:11–12], who was standing among the myrtle trees. They said, “We have ·gone [walked; patrolled] through all the earth, and [look; behold] everything is calm and quiet.”

Then the ·Lord’s angel [angel of the Lord; v. 11] asked, “Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], how long will ·it be before you show [you withhold] mercy to Jerusalem and the cities of Judah? You have been angry with them for seventy years now.”
So the Lord answered the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me, and his words were comforting and good.

Then the ·angel [messenger] who was talking to me said to me, “Announce this: This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘I ·have a strong love [am very jealous/zealous; Nah. 1:2] for Jerusalem.
And I am very angry with the nations that feel so ·safe [secure; at ease]. I was only a little angry at them, but they ·made things worse [added to/increased the calamity/disaster].’

“So this is what the Lord says: ‘I will return to Jerusalem with mercy. My ·Temple [house] will be rebuilt,’ says the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], ‘and the measuring line will be ·used to rebuild [stretched out over] Jerusalem.’

“Also announce: This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts] says: ‘My towns will ·be rich again [overflow with prosperity]. The Lord will comfort Jerusalem again, and I will again choose Jerusalem.’”
Then I looked up and saw four ·animal horns [horns; animal horns symbolized strength].
I asked the ·angel [messenger] who was talking with me, “What are these?”
Then the Lord showed me four craftsmen.
I asked, “What are they coming to do?”
